Routines

Handling Fonts in Memory

The Font Manager provides two routines that allow you to manipulate fonts in memory. The SetFontLock procedure makes a font resource, which is normally purgeable data in memory, unpurgeable. The FlushFonts function erases the Font Manager's memory caches, including resource data and any width tables the Font Manager may have built.
